item.title: Wife, her mother and brother get bail in case of abetting Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's suicide - NDTV
item.description:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Date: Today | Source: Bengaluru Court

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in the abetment of suicide case against them following Subhash's suicide on December 9.

  • Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania and her family were accused of harassment leading to his death.
  • They had previously appealed to the Karnataka High Court for expedited bail proceedings.
  • Subhash left a video and a detailed note accusing his wife and her relatives of torturing him.
  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram; her family members were arrested in Prayagraj.
  • The parents of Subhash are seeking custody of their grandson.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” said Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father.

This case raises serious concerns about marital harassment and the mental health of individuals facing familial pressures.

item.title: Pant's blitz and Test cricket on warp-speed at SCG - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Pant's Blitz and Test Cricket on Warp-Speed at SCG

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Cricbuzz

Rishabh Pant played a remarkable innings against Australia at the SCG, scoring 61 runs off just 33 balls, showcasing a rapid approach to Test cricket on a challenging pitch.

  • Pant's explosive knock highlighted a day of fast-paced Test cricket where over 300 runs were scored.
  • The match saw a total of 15 wickets fall, indicating a day full of action and drama.
  • Virat Kohli faced a disappointing end in his final Test innings on Australian soil.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Siraj were instrumental in bowling early breakthroughs.
Pant was providing a blueprint to every other batter who'd take strike in Sydney for the reminder of the match.

The match showcased the unpredictability of Test cricket, as all outcomes remained possible heading into the climax of the series.

item.title: HMPV outbreak in China: Telangana govt issues dos and don'ts — check details here | Today News - Mint
item.description:
HMPV Outbreak in China: Telangana Government Issues Guidelines

Publication Date: Saturday

Source: Live Mint

The Telangana state government has issued a set of precautionary measures amid rising concerns over an HMPV outbreak in China, although no cases have been reported in Telangana.

Key Points

  • The Telangana health department reported no significant increase in respiratory infections compared to the previous year.
  • Dr. Atul Goyal advised general precautions and noted the lack of alarm.
  • Common symptoms of HMPV include cough, fever, nasal congestion, and shortness of breath.
  • The government issued specific do's and don'ts for citizens to follow.

Do’s

  • Cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing.
  • Wash hands regularly with soap or sanitizer.
  • Avoid crowded places and maintain distance from sick individuals.
  • Stay home if feeling unwell.
  • Stay hydrated and consume nutritious food.

Don’ts

  • Do not reuse tissues or handkerchiefs.
  • Avoid close contact with sick individuals.
  • Steer clear of touching your face frequently.
  • Do not spit in public areas.
  • Avoid self-medication without professional advice.
“We are monitoring the situation in China. If an outbreak is detected that has the potential to spread to other areas, we can check its spread very quickly,” said Kerala Health Minister Veena George.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
item.description:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi Airport

Published: January 04, 2025 07:34 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The national capital experienced severe fog conditions, leading to significant disruptions at Indira Gandhi International Airport with over 300 flights affected.

  • Zero visibility for nine hours caused 335 flight delays, 41 cancellations, and 19 diversions.
  • Conditions affected not only Delhi but also Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, and several other northern states.
  • Delhi's visibility dropped to below 50 meters, impacting landings and departures.
  • IndiGo and Air India issued alerts regarding the disruptions due to dense fog.
  • CAT III compliant flights were less affected by the conditions.
“Dense fog continues to affect visibility in Delhi, Chandigarh, Srinagar, Guwahati and Patna even during daytime hours.” - IndiGo

This incident highlights the ongoing challenges of weather-related travel disruptions in major Indian cities.

item.title: Who is Edward Pettifer? Brit killed in New Orleans attack shared deep links to Royals as King Charles… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Edward Pettifer? Brit killed in New Orleans attack shared deep links to Royals as King Charles…

Date: January 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Edward Pettifer, a 31-year-old Brit, was tragically killed in a terrorist attack in New Orleans, which resulted in 14 fatalities. His familial connections to the Royal Family have come to light following this shocking incident.

  • Pettifer was identified as the stepson of Tiggy Legge-Bourke, the former nanny of Prince William and Prince Harry.
  • He succumbed to “blunt force injuries” after a pickup truck attack during a New Year’s party.
  • His family expressed profound grief, highlighting his role as a beloved son and friend.
  • King Charles reportedly expressed sadness and reached out to Pettifer’s family.
“We will all miss him terribly,” said Edward's family regarding their loss.

This horrific event not only resulted in a significant loss of life but also revealed deep ties between the victim and the British royal family, which has sparked widespread media coverage and public sympathy.

item.title: CISF jawan shoots himself dead at Surat Airport - The Times of India
item.description:
CISF jawan shoots himself dead at Surat Airport

Date: October 4, 2023 Source: Times of India

A tragic incident occurred at Surat Airport where a Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) jawan took his own life.

  • The incident happened early in the morning, causing shock among the airport staff.
  • The identity of the jawan has been disclosed, and further investigation is underway.
  • Authorities are looking into possible reasons leading to this tragic event.
"This is a distressing incident, and we will ensure a thorough investigation is conducted." - CISF spokesperson

This unfortunate event highlights the mental health challenges faced by security personnel.

item.title: 3 Soldiers Die As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In Jammu And Kashmir - NDTV
item.description:
Three Soldiers Die in Army Vehicle Accident in Jammu and Kashmir

Date: Saturday Source: Srinagar

Three soldiers died after an Army truck skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district. Bad weather contributed to the accident.

  • Incident occurred near the SK Payen area at around 2.30 pm.
  • The Army expressed gratitude towards Kashmiri locals for their assistance in evacuating injured soldiers.
  • Heartfelt condolences were offered to the bereaved families by the Army.
  • This incident follows another vehicle accident last month in which five soldiers died.
“Tragically three bravehearts lost their lives in the unfortunate accident. Indian Army extends heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families.”

The tragic loss of these soldiers highlights the dangers faced by military personnel in challenging weather conditions.

item.title: With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Kohli calls the shots - The Indian Express
item.description:
With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Virat Kohli displayed strong leadership on the field during the Test match against Australia, stepping up as captain while Jasprit Bumrah dealt with a back spasm. Despite some initial missteps, Kohli managed the field positions and worked closely with bowlers to maintain pressure on the Australia batting lineup.

  • Kohli initially occupied the wrong slip position but quickly corrected it.
  • After Bumrah left the field, Kohli took over field placements and animatedly directed play.
  • He provided encouragement and strategic advice to bowlers like Prasidh Krishna and Mohammad Siraj.
  • Kohli celebrated the team's successes and maintained high energy throughout the innings.
“They are new boys. I know they should be given responsibility. But let them earn it.” - Rohit Sharma

Kohli's performance highlighted his experience and dedication, as he effectively managed the team's strategy even in Bumrah's absence.

item.title: No need to worry over reports of China flu outbreak: Kerala health minister - Business Standard
item.description:
No need to worry over reports of China flu outbreak: Kerala health minister

Date: Jan 04 2025 | Source: Press Trust of India, Thiruvananthapuram

Kerala Health Minister Veena George addresses concerns regarding the outbreak of viral infections in China, assuring that there is no need for public panic as they monitor the situation closely.

  • George stated there have been no reports of a pandemic-causing virus from China.
  • Extra caution is advised for vulnerable groups like pregnant women, children, and the elderly.
  • The National Centre for Disease Control is monitoring the situation and coordinating with international agencies.
  • Health officials describe the Human Metapneumovirus as comparable to common respiratory viruses.
"We are monitoring the situation in China. If an outbreak is detected that has the potential to spread to other areas, we can check its spread very quickly." - Veena George

The Kerala government is taking preventive measures and remains vigilant in response to reports from China, emphasizing the importance of awareness and health safety.

item.title: Who was R Chidambaram, scientist involved in 1974 'Op Smiling Buddha', Pokhran tests? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who was R Chidambaram, scientist involved in 1974 'Op Smiling Buddha', Pokhran tests?

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rajagopala Chidambaram, a prominent physicist and leader in India's nuclear program, passed away at age 88 on January 4, 2025. He is celebrated for his roles in both the 1974 'Smiling Buddha' and the 1998 Pokhran-II tests, which confirmed India's status as a nuclear power.

  • Chidambaram served as Principal Scientific Adviser (2001–2018) and director of Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (1990-1993).
  • His contributions helped advance India's nuclear capabilities and scientific research, impacting sectors like energy and healthcare.
  • He was recognised with honors such as the Padma Shri (1975) and Padma Vibhushan (1999) for his work.
  • Chidambaram's research greatly influenced materials science and high-pressure physics in India.
“His unparalleled contributions to India's scientific and strategic capabilities and his visionary leadership in science and technology will forever be remembered.” - Department of Atomic Energy

R. Chidambaram's legacy is marked by his dedication to scientific excellence and national progress in nuclear technology.

item.title: WTC Final On Line, Injured Jasprit Bumrah To Bat But Report Says Bowling Will Be... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
WTC Final On Line, Injured Jasprit Bumrah To Bat But Report Says Bowling Will Be...

Date: January 25, 2025   Source: NDTV

India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah faces uncertainty in the ongoing WTC Final against Australia following a back spasm.

  • Bumrah suffered the injury on Day 2 after bowling one over.
  • Prasidh Krishna confirmed that Bumrah is undergoing a scan and is being monitored by the medical staff.
  • A report suggests Bumrah is cleared to bat, with a decision regarding his bowling still pending.
  • India was at 141-6, trailing Australia, who were dismissed for 181, needing to win to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Bumrah was taken for a precautionary scan after a back spasm but nothing serious at the moment.”

The outcome of Bumrah's injury will be critical as India aims to recover the series from Australia.

Recent leaks of the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra highlight its ultra-thin bezels and more rounded corners. These design features align with previous renders, suggesting an exciting new look for the flagship device.

  • The design matches previously leaked renders.
"The tiny bezels could potentially be thinner than those on many rival phones."

The Galaxy S25 Ultra is set to be unveiled soon, with anticipation building around its design and upgraded internals.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: Salman Khan confronts Chahat Pandey over her mom's remarks against Avinash Mishra; host sha - The Times of India
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: Salman Khan confronts Chahat Pandey over her mom's remarks against Avinash Mishra; host shares personal photos, hinting at her love life

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The upcoming Weekend Ka Vaar episode of Bigg Boss 18 is set to be packed with intense drama as host Salman Khan addresses important topics surrounding Chahat Pandey and her mother's comments about Avinash Mishra.

  • Chahat Pandey's mother criticized Avinash Mishra for derogatory remarks about her daughter.
  • Salman Khan challenges Chahat about her mother’s statements and shares a personal photo to provoke her.
  • Avinash demands Chahat acknowledge her relationship based on the shared anniversary photo.
  • Kashish Kapoor apologizes to Salman for her behavior in the previous episode.
“Your mother has given you a character certificate, letting the world know what type of guy you like.” - Salman Khan

As the tension unfolds, viewers are left wondering if Chahat will admit to her relationship or deny it. The episode promises to deliver significant drama and revelations in the ongoing Bigg Boss season.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 AI: New phone with powerful display and underwater photography feature to launch on THIS day - ET Now
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 AI: Launch Details and Features Unveiled

Publication Date: January 4, 2025
Source: ET Now News

The Oppo Reno 13 series is set for an official launch in India on January 9, featuring powerful specifications and innovative photography capabilities.

  • Launch Date: January 9 at 5 PM IST, streaming on Flipkart and Oppo’s platforms.
  • Expected to feature OLED panels, aerospace-grade aluminum frame, and Gorilla Glass 7i.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 8350 processor with options up to 12GB RAM and 512GB storage.
  • IP68 and IP69 ratings for water and dust resistance.
  • Includes AI features like AI LivePhoto and AI Unblur Photo.
  • Reno 13 Pro features a telephoto super zoom camera with up to 120x digital zoom.
  • Expected price for Reno 13 starts at Rs 32,999; Reno 13 Pro around Rs 40,000.
  • Battery life: Reno 13 Pro with 5,800mAh and 80W SuperVOOC charging, standard Reno 13 with 5,600mAh.
“The Reno 13 Pro will feature a 3.5x telephoto super zoom camera with a significant upgrade for photography enthusiasts.”

This launch marks another significant addition to Oppo's Reno series, showcasing advanced technology and smart features tailored for photography lovers.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Leaks: Upcoming Flagship Smartphone Might Be Powered By Snapdragon 8 Elite Chipset - ABP Live
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Leaks: Upcoming Flagship Smartphone Might Be Powered By Snapdragon 8 Elite Chipset

Publication Date: January 22, 2025

Source: ABP News

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is poised to be unveiled at the upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event. This model is anticipated to be the premium offering in the S25 series, which may also include the S25 Slim, launching later.

  • The S25 Ultra is expected to feature Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • Rumored introduction of a 16GB RAM variant for improved performance.
  • Expected upgrades to display durability through second-generation Corning Gorilla Glass Armor.
  • A new 50MP ultra-wide camera sensor to enhance mobile photography.

In summary, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra introduces significant upgrades that promise to elevate user experience and performance in the flagship smartphone market.

item.title: ‘We are monitoring situation in China’: Kerala health minister on HMPV fears - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘We are monitoring situation in China’: Kerala health minister on HMPV fears

Date: Recent news from Kerala

Source: The Indian Express

Kerala Health Minister Veena George addressed concerns regarding an outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in China, assuring the public that the situation is being closely monitored without cause for panic. She recommended that sick children stay home and advised masks for vulnerable populations.

  • The state is monitoring respiratory diseases, especially among children and the elderly.
  • Travelers from abroad, particularly China, will be monitored for respiratory symptoms.
  • The first Covid-19 case in India was reported in Kerala.
  • HMPV has been present globally, including Kerala, for over 50 years.
  • Local labs are equipped to detect HMPV and its potential strains.
“Those with respiratory symptoms should use masks. There is no reason to panic. We are monitoring the situation in China,” said the minister.

Overall, while the outbreak poses concerns, the health ministry is prepared and stresses that public health measures are in place.

item.title: Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted

Date: January 4, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Flight and train operations have been severely impacted in Delhi due to dense fog, leading to flight diversions and delays.

  • Normal operations have resumed at Delhi airport after interruptions.
  • A total of 19 flights were diverted due to adverse weather conditions early Saturday.
  • IndiGo and Air India reported temporary halts in operations due to extremely low visibility.
  • 81 trains were delayed at New Delhi station also owing to the fog.
  • Cold wave conditions affected several regions, including Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan.
“Due to adverse weather conditions in Delhi, 19 flight diversions were reported between 0015 hours and 0130 hours. Operations have now returned to normal.” - Delhi International Airport Limited

The recovery of operations signifies a return to normalcy at Delhi airport, but the impact of the weather has disrupted travel significantly.

item.title: 2 Soldiers Die, 2 Injured As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In J&K - NDTV
item.description:
Three Soldiers Die in Army Vehicle Accident in Jammu and Kashmir

Date: Saturday Source: Srinagar

Three soldiers died after an Army truck skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district. Bad weather contributed to the accident.

  • Incident occurred near the SK Payen area at around 2.30 pm.
  • The Army expressed gratitude towards Kashmiri locals for their assistance in evacuating injured soldiers.
  • Heartfelt condolences were offered to the bereaved families by the Army.
  • This incident follows another vehicle accident last month in which five soldiers died.
“Tragically three bravehearts lost their lives in the unfortunate accident. Indian Army extends heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families.”

The tragic loss of these soldiers highlights the dangers faced by military personnel in challenging weather conditions.

item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: [Source Not Provided]

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has indicated a cautious approach from the Modi government in addressing ongoing farmers’ protests, contrasting with previous engagement levels during earlier agitations.

  • Farmers have been protesting at Shambhu and Khanauri since February 2024.
  • The current protests differ from the previous agitation against the now-repealed farm laws, focusing on issues like minimum support price and farm debt waivers.
  • The government believes earlier engagement escalated tensions rather than resolved issues.
  • Minister Chouhan offers weekly meetings yet has not engaged directly with the protesting farmers.
  • The protesting farmers have not participated in discussions with the government’s committee formed to address agricultural issues.
“Currently, the Supreme Court is looking into this issue. Whatever directives the Supreme Court gives, will be followed,” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan.

The Modi government's current strategy seems to prioritize a more detached stance amid a complicated landscape of farmers' demands and protests.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Here's How You Can Check Allotment Status Online - ABP Live
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Here's How You Can Check Allotment Status Online

Date: 04 Jan 2025

Source: ABP Live

Investors can check the Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment status online via the BSE, NSE websites, or the official portal of the IPO registrar, Mas Services. The allocation is expected to finalize soon, with shares being listed on January 7, 2025.

  • The IPO bidding concluded with strong demand.
  • The IPO allotment status will be available on January 4, 2025.
  • Shares will be credited to successful bidders on January 6, 2025.
  • Refunds for unsuccessful bidders will also be initiated on the same day.
  • The price band for the IPO ranges from Rs 204 to Rs 215 per share.
"The company has raised Rs 260.15 crore through the book-built issue."

This IPO is a significant opportunity for investors looking to participate in the market. The checking process is straightforward, and timely checking is encouraged.
